page.title: 13Religion
page.content: There are four main church groups in the village where about a quarter of the people surveyed attend the services_about a quarter of these attened sometimes or when there is a special service The Churches represented in the village are as follows: The Church of England which holds services at St. Peters church which dates back to the year 980 when it was founded by the Monks of Thorney. The Methodist which hold services at the Methodist chapel in Main St. The United Reformed Church who hold services on Sundays at the United Reformed Church also in Main St. The Roman Catholic community have no building of their own but use the Amenity Centre for their Sunday service.
